Virginian Station
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Virginian Railway Passenger Station, also known as the Virginian Station is a former rail station in Roanoke, Virginia. ... the Virginian Station served as a passenger station for the Virginian Railway between 1910 and 1956. Closed after the merger of the Virginia Railway with Norfolk And Western Ralway, 1959. It was severely damaged by fire on January 29, 2001. Restored 2012-2016. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginian_Railway_Passenger_Station [work]
